COMMENDATION
WHO and UNICEF recommend iodine supplementation for young children in countries 
where less than 20% of households have access to iodized salt, until the salt iodization 
programme is scaled up. Countries with household access to iodized salt between 20% 
and 90% should make efforts to accelerate salt iodization or assess the feasibility of 
increasing iodine intake in the form of a supplement or iodine-fortified foods by the most 
susceptible groups.
